title: Add industry track proceedings to EMNLP 2022
body: Missing industry track proceedings in https://aclanthology.org/events/emnlp-2022/.

title: Bug report
body:
Dear editors,

I am writing on behalf of a team of authors of a paper that was accepted to the Findings of the 2022 EMNLP conference (https://aclanthology.org/volumes/2022.findings-emnlp/) but has so far not appeared in the ACL Anthology. 

We have already contacted the editors, Yoav Goldberg and Yue Zhang, a few weeks back but other than a first acknowledgment that they will check back what the problem might be, have not heard anything.

The paper in question is:
Ana Kotarcic, Dominik Hangartner, Fabrizio Gilardi, Selina Kurer and Karsten Donnay. (2022). Human-in-the-Loop Hate Speech Classification in a Multilingual Context. In _Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics: EMNLP 2022_, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. Association for Computational Linguistics.

Please advise on how this problem will be addressed. 

With thanks,
Karsten

title: Wrong link for the paper for EMNLP 22
body:
#### Issue description

For the paper https://preview.aclanthology.org/emnlp-22-ingestion/2022.emnlp-main.149/, when I click the PDF link, it is showing a different paper with different title: Self-Distillation with Meta Learning for Knowledge Graph Completion

Update: just randomly checked several other papers, and the mapping are all wrong.

1. Enter the link provided in the description
2. Click the PDF link
3. Check the titles

#### What's the expected result?
The same paper as in the preview page.

#### What's the actual result?
A different paper PDF

An insecure connection and warning of a potential security risk. #### Additional details / screenshot

title: DOI doesn't fully work with NSF-PAR
body:
#### Issue description

In the U.S., work funded by the National Science Foundation has to be deposited into their repository, NSF-PAR.  The easiest way to upload a paper is to provide the DOI to the NSF-PAR system.  This works correctly for TACL DOIs.  However, for the DOIs that are managed by the ACL Anthology, it only works partially and I have to fill in the proceedings title and optionally other info.

#### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Visit https://nsfpar.research.gov/addproduct.html with an NSF account
2. Choose "publication" and "Yes, the DOI number is available"
3. Enter 10.18653/v1/2022.acl-long.110 and submit

#### What's the expected result?

The bibliographic data for the paper should appear.
That is what you get with a TACL URL, such as 10.1162/tacl_a_00060:

- ![screenshot754](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2395181/182444760-30f50284-186c-4da6-b88c-68fcdcaab7b0.png)

#### What's the actual result?

A form with incomplete bibliographic data, which prompts to fill in the conference proceedings title and potentially make other changes.  

The proceedings title, month, and abstract are all missing on this form, even though they're available from the Anthology page. 

This screen does correctly show the publication's title, authors, page range, and year, although the publication date is given as January 1 of that year.

- ![screenshot753](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2395181/182444712-8607ac23-68f1-448c-a3e9-85da2c6adc82.png)

#### Additional details

I don't know how bib info is harvested from DOIs, but I'm guessing that the DOI is resolved to a webpage and the info is retrieved from in meta fields in the HTML.  In that case, maybe the Anthology webpage doesn't provide quite the right meta fields, whereas the TACL webpage does?

Here's a [guide to NSF-PAR](https://www.research.gov/common/attachment/Desktop/NSF-PAR_Getting_Started_Guide.pdf).

title: Anthology search always shows a maximum of 100 papers (10 pages with 10 papers)
body:
#### Issue description
Anthology search always shows maximally 100 papers, even if the amount found that is indicated is much higher.

#### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Go to the search engine, type in a search word with a lot of hits, for instance, "multi-lingual"
2. Click on "year of publication" to restrict to papers

#### What's the expected result?
When I search for "multi-lingual", the search engine reports that there are about 4100 results found in (0.26 seconds). What I would expect, is that I can actually see all those 4100 papers. 

#### What's the actual result?
Instead, I can see only 100 papers, and this number does not change if I use different search terms.

title: Bug report: DeepLo 2022 abstract in BibTeX and webpage
body:
#### Issue description

All the abstracts in DeepLo 2022 BibTeX files and paper landing pages are simply the string "t". This was true for all of the handful of bib files I checked in deepLo and true for none of the conference/workshop files I checked in naacl 2022 but not in deeplo. I did not check exhaustively. 

Additionally, the last two authors are combined in every paper in a way that makes them appear as a single author. E.g.

```@inproceedings{micallef-etal-2022-pre,
    title = "Pre-training Data Quality and Quantity for a Low-Resource Language: New Corpus and {BERT} Models for {M}altese",
    author = "Micallef, Kurt  and
      Gatt, Albert  and
      Tanti, Marc  and
      van der Plas and Claudia Borg, Lonneke",
    booktitle = "Proceedings of the Third Workshop on Deep Learning for Low-Resource Natural Language Processing",
    month = jul,
    year = "2022",
    address = "Hybrid",
    publisher = "Association for Computational Linguistics",
    url = "https://aclanthology.org/2022.deeplo-1.10",
    pages = "90--101",
    abstract = "t",
}
```

This creates a final author with the last name `van der Plas and Claudia Borg` and the first name `Lonneke`. That in turn creates a new author page for this hybrid person: https://aclanthology.org/people/l/lonneke-van-der-plas-and-claudia-borg/


#### Steps to reproduce the issue

Open https://aclanthology.org/2022.deeplo-1.8.bib or https://aclanthology.org/2022.deeplo-1.8/ and compare to the actual abstract in https://aclanthology.org/2022.deeplo-1.8.pdf (can be repeated with other similar papers)

#### What's the expected result?

Abstract text should match that in the pdf. Author corrections should be separated.


#### What's the actual result?

Abstract text is simply "t". Two-headed authors have been created.

title: Bug report: 2022.naacl-main.13 leads to incorrect PDF

#### 2022.naacl-main.13 leads to incorrect PDF


#### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. https://aclanthology.org/2022.naacl-main.13/ leads to paper titled "Two Contrasting Data Annotation Paradigms for Subjective NLP Tasks"
2. Click on "PDF" on the abstract / title landing page. 
3. https://aclanthology.org/2022.naacl-main.13.pdf loads "MULTIVERS: Improving scientific claim verification with weak supervision and full-document context"

The PDF should match the paper. 

#### What's the actual result?

The PDF leads to a different paper.

title: Bug report-different statistics of papers from website
body:
#### Issue description
Hi, we are a team who want to contribute to ACL anthology by extracting text from pdf files and further apply SOTA NLP toolkits on the extracted text.  

When I use `make mirror` to download pdf files from the latest ACL anthology corpus on July 6th. Yield 72889 files under `./build/anthology-files/pdf/` on 8th. While the https://aclanthology.org/ website says 

> The ACL Anthology currently hosts 76XXX papers on the study of computational linguistics and natural language processing.

sorry forget the exact number as it is updated to 77762 files today.

#### What's the expected result?

Same number with the website.

#### What's the actual result?

A few thousands lower than expected.

#### Additional details / screenshot

I use the `find ./ -name *.pdf > filelist.txt` command to  retrieve all pdf files under the `./build/anthology-files/pdf/` 

A second trial on July 12th yield 74234 files with a full log file indicating we only have 1 paper failed to download.

title: No `build/anthology` folder after running `make`
body:
Hi, I am trying to build the website locally. I followed the steps provided in the ReadMe, and at the end I get this output after running `hugo --minify`

```
                   |   EN    
-------------------+---------
  Pages            | 138163  
  Paginator pages  |      0  
  Non-page files   |      1  
  Static files     |  77059  
  Processed images |      0  
  Aliases          |      0  
  Sitemaps         |      1  
  Cleaned          |      0 
```

which I assume means that the build was successful. However, I can't find the `anthology` folder in the `build` directory to actually render the pages on my browser.

Any pointers would be really appreciated!

title: Don’t display joint volumes on venue page
body: I think that a venue page should not display all the colocated volumes. These should be displayed only on the events page. For example, [ACL’s venue page](https://aclanthology.org/venues/acl/) is cluttered with colocated volumes that make it hard to see what is published just by ACL.

(What I'd really like under posts/ is a blog (#722).)

title: Bug report
body:
The aclweb.org/anthology links have stopped working! 

URLs such as 
https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/W19-4440/
https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/2020.coling-main.509 
http://www.aclweb.org/anthology/N18-1011.pdf
now result in a page not found error.

URLs without the www, e.g.
https://aclweb.org/anthology/W19-4440/
https://aclweb.org/anthology/2020.coling-main.509 
http://aclweb.org/anthology/N18-1011.pdf
that also used to work fine and are common short forms used in many bibliographies also stopped
working but instead of a file not found an Error 22 is returned.

Note that this problem also applies for doi entries resolving to the acl anthology. For example 
http://dx.doi.org/10.18653/v1/2020.coling-main.509
for a paper at COLING 2020 that resolves to 
https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/2020.coling-main.509
is now resulting in page not found.

If one replaces http://www.aclwerb.org/anthology/ with https://aclanthology.org/ that works - but it would be important for the aclweb.org/anthology links, which were/are commonly used in many publications and on web pages, to also remain functional!

title: Anthology gives 404 after name changes
body:
#### Issue description
Following #1598, searching for authors with a name change now results in a 404 error if you try to click through to the author from the search results.

#### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Search for an author who has had their name changed (like Miruna Clinciu).
2. Navigate to their page from the [search results](https://aclanthology.org/search/?q=clinciu).
3. You will get a 404 error for [the relevant page](https://aclanthology.org/people/m/miruna-adriana-clinciu/).

#### What's the expected result?
The expected result is to land on the author page. (Possibly redirected from their old author page.)

#### What's the actual result?
A 404 error.


#### Additional details / screenshot
I am not sure whether this is just a single error, or whether this holds for all authors who have had their name changed in the Anthology.

title: possible issue with anthology search
body:
For some ACL 2021 papers (found specifically for some IWSLT 2021 papers) searching the exact paper title in the anthology returns nothing. However, they are in the anthology, and searching these papers on google turns up the paper in the anthology, suggesting it has been indexed. 

Examples: 
- Searching "ZJU’s IWSLT 2021 Speech Translation System" gives ["No Results"](https://aclanthology.org/search/?q=ZJU%E2%80%99s+IWSLT+2021+Speech+Translation+System), but the paper is [here](https://aclanthology.org/2021.iwslt-1.16/) in the Anthology, and searching the title on google rather than the anthology [returns the paper](https://www.google.com/search?client=ms-google-coop&q=ZJU%E2%80%99s+IWSLT+2021+Speech+Translation+System&cx=000299513257099441687:fkkgoogvtaw) -- in the Anthology
- This is less immediately obvious for some papers, where search returns related papers/people, but not the paper in question (see paper metadata on [this search](https://aclanthology.org/search/?q=Edinburgh%E2%80%99s+End-to-End+Multilingual+Speech+Translation+System+for+IWSLT+2021)), but again, the anthology link is returned by google

Screenshots:
- ![anthology screenshot](https://files.slack.com/files-pri/T409KA55G-F02BLMR7BME/image.png)
- ![google screenshot](https://files.slack.com/files-pri/T409KA55G-F02B3968ZQU/image.png)

title: Dummy frontmatter is causing problems
body:
The EAMT ingestion introduced a "dummy frontmatter" to the code to make sure volume editors were properly registered:

https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/blob/138f318a22c66db63d348e54402768b7190b365d/bin/anthology/volumes.py#L88-L90

Unfortunately, that's causing problems, including:

1. Iterating through `anthology.papers` yields objects that have no representation in the XML. *(I've stumbled on this trying to add bibkeys to the XML.)*
2. The website generates empty spaces both on volume entries ...
  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11348502/124798890-31c25b80-df54-11eb-9e1f-477245b98887.png)

3. ...and on the author pages:
  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11348502/124798920-3be45a00-df54-11eb-8b02-0c85b5208a1e.png)

4. Their respective BibTeX entries are invalid as they don't have titles:
  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11348502/124798976-4c94d000-df54-11eb-98a8-02c1549c5076.png)

I've attempted a quick fix (https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/tree/fix-dummy-frontmatter) but it's not working as I hoped, so this might be a tricky problem to solve.

_Originally posted by @BramVanroy in https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/issues/170#issuecomment-872320378_

title: ACL Anthology pages link to a harmful, unreliable source, Google Scholar
body:
#### Issue description

ACL Anthology pages contain a prominent link to an harmful, unreliable source, Google Scholar, which spreads misinformation about trans people in academia.

Google Scholar fails to implement a mechanism for an author to change their name, so in most cases it calls trans authors by their deadname. Additionally, when a trans author changes their name with publishers, Google Scholar sees the new name as a different author with metrics that make them nearly invisible. The Google Scholar results for trans authors -- and in some cases for anyone who changes their name -- are not reliable.

Google Scholar's unearned credibility convinces many authors to make their bibliographies by typing paper names or project names into Google Scholar, and taking citation information from the first result. This results in them frequently calling trans authors by their deadnames.

A work environment where trans people are habitually called by their deadnames is a hostile work environment, and should not be tolerated, in academia or anywhere.

Many authors who accidentally deadname a trans person say that Google Scholar is what convinced them to do it, as shown at https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/issues/1331 . I am told that Google has been aware of the problem (in the form of an internal bug report) for years, and that they have been dismissive of it and assigned it a very low priority.

The inappropriate use of Google Scholar in the ACL community to provide bibliographic information also has other visible effects, such as the unfortunately common practice of referring to papers with peer-reviewed publications as "arXiV preprint".

#### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Go to the ACL Anthology overview page for any paper, or a volume such as https://aclanthology.org/volumes/2021.naacl-main/.
2. Look at the three links on the side.
3. The third one, Search, goes to Google Scholar, an unreliable source that habitually calls trans authors by their deadnames with no recourse.

#### What's the expected result?

ACL Anthology should not link to harmful sources. The "Search" link could be removed, or changed so that it searches the ACL Anthology itself.

#### What's the actual result?

The link goes to Google Scholar, assigning legitimacy to that site even though its design can only work for people who never change their names (a group that largely overlaps with cis men). Authors click the link and retrieve inaccurate information that they perpetuate in their own bibliographies.

#### Additional details / screenshot

- ![Screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/234227/119571748-c0519380-bd7f-11eb-80f9-cd4273f94a8b.PNG)

title: Bug report: preview overwrites root
body:
Every once in a while, the root of aclanthology.org gets overwritten by the syncing preview. For example, right now, aclanthology.org redirects to http://localhost:8000/previews/ingest-amta-2006, and the browser displays a failure.

This must have to do with the [preview workflow target](https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/blob/master/.github/workflows/preview.yml), but I can't figure out how, since it only happens sometimes.

title: Duplicate acronyms on venue pages
body:
#### Issue description
In venues.yaml a few venues list their acronym in brackets as part of the name field, e.g. _"International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING)"_. However, this information is already specified in the acronym field. On the [venue's page](https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/venues/coling/) this results in an acronym duplication: "International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING) (COLING)"

#### Solution
I have removed the acronyms from name fields to fix this, see #1316

#### Additional details
The one case I did not touch yet (although I think it should also be changed) is _DeeLIO_, because the acronym is mentioned in the middle of the name: "Deep Learning Inside Out (DeeLIO): The Workshop on Knowledge Extraction and Integration for Deep Learning Architectures".

title: Bug report: Inconsistent bibtex key for papers with similar prefix
body:
*Use this issue template to help file your issue. Please delete portions that are not relevant, and feel free to change it or add sections.*

#### Issue description
In an earlier version of `anthology.bib`, the key prefix `wang-etal-2017-deep` has the following candidates.

```bibtex
@inproceedings{wang-etal-2017-deep,
    title = "Deep Neural Machine Translation with Linear Associative Unit",
    author = "Wang, Mingxuan  and
      Lu, Zhengdong  and
      Zhou, Jie  and
      Liu, Qun",
    booktitle = "Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 1: Long Papers)",
    month = jul,
    year = "2017",
    address = "Vancouver, Canada",
    publisher = "Association for Computational Linguistics",
    url = "https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/P17-1013",
    doi = "10.18653/v1/P17-1013",
    pages = "136--145",
}

@inproceedings{wang-etal-2017-deep-neural,
    title = "Deep Neural Solver for Math Word Problems",
    author = "Wang, Yan  and
      Liu, Xiaojiang  and
      Shi, Shuming",
    booktitle = "Proceedings of the 2017 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing",
    month = sep,
    year = "2017",
    address = "Copenhagen, Denmark",
    publisher = "Association for Computational Linguistics",
    url = "https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/D17-1088",
    doi = "10.18653/v1/D17-1088",
    pages = "845--854",
}
```

Using the latest `anthology.bib.gz`, the same key prefix leads to different orders of the papers
```bibtex
@inproceedings{wang-etal-2017-deep-neural,
    title = "Deep Neural Machine Translation with Linear Associative Unit",
    author = "Wang, Mingxuan  and
      Lu, Zhengdong  and
      Zhou, Jie  and
      Liu, Qun",
    booktitle = "Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 1: Long Papers)",
    month = jul,
    year = "2017",
    address = "Vancouver, Canada",
    publisher = "Association for Computational Linguistics",
    url = "https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/P17-1013",
    doi = "10.18653/v1/P17-1013",
    pages = "136--145",
}

@inproceedings{wang-etal-2017-deep,
    title = "Deep Neural Solver for Math Word Problems",
    author = "Wang, Yan  and
      Liu, Xiaojiang  and
      Shi, Shuming",
    booktitle = "Proceedings of the 2017 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing",
    month = sep,
    year = "2017",
    address = "Copenhagen, Denmark",
    publisher = "Association for Computational Linguistics",
    url = "https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/D17-1088",
    doi = "10.18653/v1/D17-1088",
    pages = "845--854",
}

```

This proves that it's not consistent when generating bibtex keys for each paper, at least for very similar prefixes, the generation is not ordered.

This is a potential issue may lead to miscitation in real usage. 

#### What's the expected result?

The key should be unique as well as consistent across different releases.

#### What's the actual result?

The bibtex key will change across different releases.

title: Fail to build: 'Illegal number: hugo'
body:
*Use this issue template to help file your issue. Please delete portions that are not relevant, and feel free to change it or add sections.*

#### Issue description
I encountered this issue when running `make`:
`/bin/sh: 1: [: Illegal number: hugo`
`...`
`Makefile:149: recipe for target 'build/.mods' failed
make: *** [build/.mods] Error 123`

I downloaded `hugo_extended_0.81.0_Linux-64bit.tar.gz`, extracted the binary file and put it in one of my `PATH` : `.../miniconda/bin`, note that since I am on lab server I don't have permission to root and the global `/usr/local/bin`  

when I run `hugo help` in command line it works fine.

Any hint on what's going on?

Thanks in advance

title: LREC2020 listed as part of COLING2020
body:
LREC 2020 appears to be listed as part of COLING 2020, causing its papers to be listed there also: https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/events/coling-2020/#2020-lrec-1
The individual papers aren't duplicated, but list both venues in their description.
I assume this is a bug?

title: Make volumes adhere to the flat directory structure
body:
All our files are relatively flat, but we still have nested structures for volumes (in the build dir under `anthology/papers/`).

This looks like an oversight from a previous change and noone has complained yet.

title: Volume links are 404
body:
The "URL" field on volume pages is 404, e.g., https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/2020.acl-main.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/455256/93599234-cccd5300-f98b-11ea-838c-fd6a0a13c3de.png)

We need to either (a) update `.htaccess` to recognize and redirect volume links or (b) update the URL to https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/volumes/2020.acl-main

title: ACL 2020 software/dataset attachments

labels.name: correction
labels.description: for corrections submitted to the anthology

body: [This paper](https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/2020.acl-main.462/) is listed as having a software attachment—I'm not sure why (I don't think we submitted one). The software link is broken, which seems to be the case for all papers.

title: Q19-1005 through 1014 are 404
body: PDF links for TACL 2019 only work for me up to Q19-1004; the papers Q19-1005 and higher are 404.

title: First name displays as "false"
body: See: https://aclweb.org/anthology/people/n/n-veilleux/

title: 1977 workshop not listed on main page
body:
On the main page:

    http://www.aclweb.org/anthology/

There is no entry for "77" in the "WS" row, even though this workshop and page exists:

    http://www.aclweb.org/anthology/events/ws-1977/

title: No page numbers before 2005
body:
Page numbers and other bib info are present in the bib entries in the old anthology, but seem to have gotten dropped.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/4i3rqsy12x637ho/anthology_bib.tgz?dl=0

title: Q16 has been overwritten with contents of Q15
body: This was introduced by commit 867a48df6a877b3567b3048e3f6c505a22915a0b.  The file `Q16.xml` seems to have the old contents of `Q15.xml` (without the abstracts), while the information about Q16 appears to have been lost in the process.

title: Missing EMNLP 2018 proceedings bibtex files
body:
The link to the full proceedings bibtex files from the [EMNLP 2018 proceedings page](https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/events/emnlp-2018) returns a "We're sorry, something went wrong" page:

    https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/volumes/proceedings-of-the-2018-conference-on-empirical-methods-in-natural-language-processing.bib
    https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/volumes/proceedings-of-the-2018-conference-on-empirical-methods-in-natural-language-processing-system-demonstrations.bib

title: BibTeX export lacks a month field

milestone.title: Static Rewrite
milestone.description: The first milestone for the Anthology is to [regenerate the site statically](https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/wiki/Anthology-Static-Rewrite).

body: The HTML publication records in the Anthology include a month field, but this field does not appear in the BibTeX export.  Please consider including this field in the BibTeX record.  Note that, wherever possible, the value of this field should be a standard BibTeX month macro (`jan`, `feb`, `mar`, etc.) and not a string (`{January}`, `"February"`, etc.) as this allows bibliographies to be localized by the BibTeX style.

title: Ensure casing for bibtex generated in the anthology.
body: Currently casing is not preserved when generating the bibtex files that are published in the anthology, we need to look into a simple solution for preserving this information.

title: Exporting error in rake export:all_volumes
body:
When running `rake export:all_volumes`, the task stops with the following error:

```
Exporting DBLP for volume Y99-1
Exporting volume A83-1
rake aborted!
NoMethodError: undefined method `attachment' for #<Paper:0x000000041570a8>
/home/aclanthology/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.0.0-p353@acl/gems/activemodel-4.0.1/lib/active_model/attribute_methods.rb:439:in `method_missing'
/home/aclanthology/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.0.0-p353@acl/gems/activerecord-4.0.1/lib/active_record/attribute_methods.rb:155:in `method_missing'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:83:in `block in export_papers_in_volume'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:21:in `each'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:21:in `export_papers_in_volume'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:148:in `block (5 levels) in <top (required)>'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:143:in `each'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:143:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:133:in `each'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:133:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:132:in `each'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:132:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'
/home/aclanthology/acl-anthology/lib/tasks/all_export.rake:46:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'
/home/aclanthology/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.0.0-p353@acl/bin/ruby_executable_hooks:15:in `eval'
/home/aclanthology/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.0.0-p353@acl/bin/ruby_executable_hooks:15:in `<main>'
Tasks: TOP => export:xml
(See full trace by running task with --trace)
```

Not sure whether it's related or not, but the line marked as causing the problem is `lib/tasks/xml_export.rake:83`, seen here:
https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/blob/7b89d3c6d36c81c76a08107901cab788659e3442/lib/tasks/xml_export.rake#L83

and it is preceded by a funny comment:

```
# TODO: To be checked for correct export later!
if @paper.attachment != "none"
```

but since this was not an issue until now, it might not be related (that TODO has been there for 4 years now).

I'll keep looking into it, but I accept ideas and/or suggestions.

title: Authors being stored under multiple spellings

milestone.title: Static Rewrite
milestone.description: The first milestone for the Anthology is to [regenerate the site statically](https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/wiki/Anthology-Static-Rewrite).

body:
We currently have over 200 authors that show up with two or more names. Some examples:
  * Josef van Genabith shows as 
    * J. Genabith
    * Josef (name) van Genabith (last name)
    * Josef Van (name) Genabith (last name)
    * Josef (name) Van Genabith (last name)
    * Josef van (name) Genabith (last name)
    * Joseph vanGenabith
    * Josef Genabith
  * Laura Alonso i Alemany shows as
    * Laura Alonso (name) i Alemany (last name)
    * Laura (name) Alonso Alemany (last name)
    * Laura Alonso (name) Alemany (last name)
  * Héctor Martínez Alonso shows as
    * Hector Martinez Alonso
    * Héctor Martínez Alonso 

Although some of these we could detect automatically (specially those caused by a missing diacritic), I imagine we might be better off fixing this manually.

Any ideas on what's the best way to proceed?

title: NAACL-HLT 2018 doesn't have HLT as a venue
body:
Papers from NAACL-HLT 2018 only have NAACL listed as a venue, not HLT as well (e.g. [paper](https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/papers/N18-1000/n18-1000)). This is different to previous years of the joint conference, where both are listed (e.g. [2016](https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/papers/N16-1000/n16-1000)). Is this an error? [This](https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/blob/master/db/joint_map.txt) seems like the relevant file.

Thanks!

title: <von> part of name not rendered by website
body:
Compare: http://aclweb.org/anthology/C18-2009.bib
With: https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/papers/C18-2009/c18-2009.bib

The second one lists my name as `Cranenburgh, Andreas`, instead of what I intended `van Cranenburgh, Andreas`. This error also appears on the website at https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/events/coling-2018#C18-2

I grep'ed the repo and discovered that in `import/C18.xml` my name is listed as:

`<author><first>Andreas</first><von>van</von><last>Cranenburgh</last></author>`

So the problem is that the material in the `<von>` tag is not being rendered.

IMHO it is better to avoid the complexity of making a special case of `<von>`, it raises many questions of how it should be handled, and these may differ by locale. Since I don't expect everyone to know my native language's name sorting rules, I like to keep the "van" as a fixed part of my last name, and have my name sorted under "v", not "C".

Where does the `<von>` tag come from? i don't see it as a separate field in my SoftConf profile. Is there a way I can ensure my name is listed as `<last>van Cranenburgh</last>` ? Curiously, this is how my name is listed in https://github.com/acl-org/acl-anthology/blob/master/import/W18.xml

title: Record the changes that we manually made to the database
body:
This is a low priority bug that has not happened yet, but it might in the future and so I'm documenting it.

Around two years ago, we modified the database to allow for re-importing volumes (see #42), which was fixed with commit 7909af5. What is _not_ clear anywhere is that we added a consistency check to the database.

This consistency check is not recorded in the scripts that Ruby uses to generate the database. In other words, if someone clones the project and builds the database from the .xml files from scratch, they may eventually run into the same issues we had.

I'm assigning this bug to myself, and should be solved in the same way of issue #64.

title: Improper escaping of < and > symbols inside XML files
body:
When importing XML files, '<' and '>' symbols cause problems. I've found two instances of papers with this problem, both in the 'abstract' section:

  * Paper 1104: "Our best model reaches 70% F-score, significantly (i.e., < 0:05) outperforming a competitive baseline."
  * Paper 2711: "missing source translations are replaced by a special symbol <NULL>."

In the first paper, the XML parser thought this was the beginning of an XML tag. In the second one, it thought that <NULL> was a tag that we forgot to close.

Workaround for 1104 was, apparently, that we simply removed the symbol. As for paper 2711, I changed '<NULL>' for '-NULL-'. Note that replacing the '<' and '>' for equivalent HTML entities (such as \< and \&#﻿60;) didn't solve this problem.

Changing the entire parser might be too complicated, but we should have at least one official solution. At the very least, we should find which piece of code is interpreting '\<' as '<' and fix that.

title: Show Volumes gets author order wrong
body:
This page still has the authors in the wrong order:

https://aclanthology.coli.uni-saarland.de/volumes/proceedings-of-the-2018-conference-of-the-north-american-chapter-of-the-association-for-computational-linguistics-human-language-technologies-volume-1-long-papers


Related to #47 (Show Events gets author order wrong) but doesn't seem to be solvable in the same way.  Likely some param being passed in that needs to be unset.

title: ERROR:  cannot truncate a table referenced in a foreign key constraint
body:
Did something change with respect to ingestion?

I didn't have this problem with re-ingesting proceedings but now it is happening.  This is for W17.xml to change one author in W17-74.

aclanthology@aclanthology:~/acl-anthology$ rake import:xml["W17"] --trace
** Invoke import:xml (first_time)
** Invoke environment (first_time)
** Execute environment
** Execute import:xml
PG::FeatureNotSupported: ERROR:  cannot truncate a table referenced in a foreign key constraint
DETAIL:  Table "papers_people" references "people".
HINT:  Truncate table "papers_people" at the same time, or use TRUNCATE ... CASCADE.
: TRUNCATE TABLE people RESTART IDENTITY;
rake aborted!
ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid: PG::FeatureNotSupported: ERROR:  cannot truncate a table referenced in a foreign key constraint
DETAIL:  Table "papers_people" references "people".
HINT:  Truncate table "papers_people" at the same time, or use TRUNCATE ... CASCADE.

title: Author order incorrect just on paper list page (D17 specifically)
body:
via email.

The author order seems likely to be a UI issue in the new anthology.
When I click on each of the papers, I see a different (correct) order of authors on the paper details page.
I also compared this to the old anthology. The old anthology appears to have the authors in the correct order too.

My guess is that the metadata has the correct order, but the web rendering is somehow reordering the authors on the page (only in paper list in the new anthology).

See screenshots:

title: Ingestion of new proceedings causes inconsistency in the database
body: When adding data for a new conference, and under some not-yet-determined circumstances, the database can end up in an inconsistent state. This is evidenced by error pages in the search functionality, as seen in issues #32, #39, and others.
